issue.title: Change permissions for assignable users
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-69](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-69). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Per comments from `[~wesmckinn]` and `[~jnadeau]` on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-64, we may want to set the "Assignable Users" permission to "Anyone". It may also be worth allowing any users to assign issues (particularly so volunteers can self-assign issues).

This may need to be done by someone with "JIRA Administrator" permissions: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/managing-project-permissions-185729636.html#ManagingProjectPermissions-permission_schemes. It may require contacting or creating an issue with INFRA (or for all I know may be against some Apache policy).
